website_summaries.verdict: Has one of the largest temperature ranges for a deep-fry thermometer while not costing much more than the cheapest models.
pros: Made of stainless steel and measures 50°F to 550°F
cons: The clip to attach the thermometer to the pot is flimsy and can be hard to use

customer_reviews.title: Good temperature control is the first part of good deep frying.
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I relied on a short-stemmed candy thermometer for deep frying. This led to burnt food, undercooked middles, and generally an unpleasant mess. The long stem and accurate, fast read let me leave this thing in my oil as I cook without having to hold it there, letting me adjust heat on the fly. My onion rings and cheburek are crispy on the outside, juicy and fully cooked on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Catbird

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget to calibrate!
customer_reviews.text: My thermometer arrived 5 degrees (C) under accurate. This was annoying, but at least there is a calibrating nut so I was able to fix it quickly...just wish I had checked before making rock hard caramel. Otherwise, the thermometer is good. The length is great for a deep pot. For candy making, I love that the temp is at the top rather than down in the pot (like other candy thermometers). Celsius markings are easy to read, Fahrenheit not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Kapela

customer_reviews.title: KT Thermo thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This has a very long prong and shows temperature within seconds. Easy to read. Oh, the attachment to put on the side of your pan does not move, so make sure you have a deep pan.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Tends to fall over while clipped to the pot- seller is replacing at no cost to me
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this thermometer to check temp of cooking oil before frying. Attached clip is not sturdy enough to prevent the thermometer from occasionally slipping. Once you set it up, one small touch or bump can cause it to fall over requiring you to reattach clip to the side of the pot. More annoying than anything. After 3 uses, I threw it out. I will purchase another brand/type of thermometer. 10/24- Raising to 4 stars for the Customer Service of seller. They suggested this thermometer may have had a defect, reached out to me directly, and is sending a free replacement. This I was not expecting and is much appreciated. Will definitely give it another try!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great but for candle making I recommend using a Inferred one this one works ok
customer_reviews.author: Texas Handmade Suds

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and very useful
customer_reviews.text: The clip that comes with this is very easy to use and versatile. I have been able to attach it to every pot I have and it is strong enough that if I needed to get creative with the clip, I could (such as clipping on a grill or smoker). Overall, great item and it seems accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Jrod

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It's a thermometer and works. I love the length of it. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice design with clip
customer_reviews.text: thermometer looks big enough for fried turkey. It is easy to read and I love that clip which can fits it on pan.
customer_reviews.author: FanOMTV

customer_reviews.title: Long enough to not fall into your garbage disposal!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my old thermometer in my garbage disposal so I got a bigger new one so it won’t accidentally fall in. It’s very long and good for turkey and deep fried meat. I use it when I cook something in the oven or in the air fryer and it does it’s job. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pdu

customer_reviews.title: Ok for meat temp reading, not so good for deep frying
customer_reviews.text: As far as using this to read meat temperature it works great. However if you’re using this to read/monitor oil for deep frying I find it to be difficult. The clip is flimsy and does not stay put on the side of the pan. Also I find the temp gauge hard to read. Will invest in a digital thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The probe is great for my deep fryer and the dial is easy to set
customer_reviews.author: andrew Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Broke from the getgo
customer_reviews.text: When I took this thermometer out of the box, it made a rattling sound when it was even slightly moved. I wasn't able to isolate the rattle to any obvious causes, such as the clip attachment or the adjustable red arrow. I decided to test it's accuracy before sending it back thinking they may just be made that way and the temperature was off approximately 15 degrees Fahrenheit. Back it went.
customer_reviews.author: BSmith

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and useful
customer_reviews.text: Nice and large. Verified temp against a true temp gage and was spot on. Great for deep pans and woks...
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but choose for right situation
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer is very long, so only use for tall pots. I have a short pot and the thermometer is not very stable and falls over. I think the temperature calibration is fine (enough) for deep frying, the food looks great. I think the clip could be a bit more grippy but in my situation, it's very top-heavy. Warning, when the Thermometer is hot, the whole thing gets very hot. You must use a glove or towel to pick it up. My fault for not buying the appropriate size and wish it had cool spot to hold on to.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It works but the clip isn’t great for frying. :/
customer_reviews.text: Used it to tell oil temp for frying chicken a couple nights ago. Useful and accurate, but the clip that holds it on the edge of the pot kept tipping and falling over pulling the tip out of the oil and causing me to restart testing the temp every time.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Broken. Literally didn't work at all. Have tried it a few times now and today tested it against another thermometer I have, it was off by 100+ degrees. Overall, do not order this. It is trash and will break within the first few days.
customer_reviews.author: Charissa

customer_reviews.title: Received damaged
customer_reviews.text: I received my thermometer and the needle was registering over 500 degrees when I took it out of the box in which it came.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of use, it started go above the temperature. Checked by using my other thermometers I have. Don’t buy
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for deep frying and decided to test it before actually using it. I'm glad I did. It read 200 degrees in boiling water. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: FrankZ

customer_reviews.title: Great-  while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this thermometer...then I made the mistake of trying to turn the clip so that I could read the dial right side up when I have it clipped onto my pot. It turned the dial and now I have no idea if the temp is accurate anymore. It’s super frustrating. Worked really well before that. I don’t want to have to spend another $12 to get another one. I tried to fix it. We will see. :(
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Clip design could be improved
customer_reviews.text: Product works; but the high temperatures dont match my digital....so one of them are off. We bought it for the clip; but the clip was not effective for smaller pots. Could not use it when deep frying in our pots which measured 5" in height. Thermometer would tilt sideways the moment you tapped it with tongs, food, etc. Because of the splash danger we now clip it with a large metal clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen t.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: I had forgot my Thermometer when taking my frying on a road trip. I ordered this and it arrived 2nd day with my prime account. I didn't realize this was extra long but that was my own fault. Works great, seems accurate and helped me keep the food frying at optimal temp.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORKING WELL  !!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thermometer for a couple of months and it's accuracy is poor. I don't get an accurate temperature when using for frying. Constantly have to use a instant-read thermometer to check it's accuracy. Not very happy. Still need a fry thermometer but will look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: K.D.

customer_reviews.title: Possibly a commercial grade type item not home friendly.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably more geared to professional restaurant use, unless you are using a large pot to fry in. The clip is not user-friendly on a smaller pot and because of the long length of the thermometer stick it leaves it unbalanced intends to slide or fall off my pot. And it's a good size what I'm using to fry with. There was one maybe three quarters to a half of this size it would probably be better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mister

customer_reviews.title: this is a junk
customer_reviews.text: save your money and spend a little more and get a good one, had to wait a long for it the rod was bent and nut on bottom was loose throw the damn thing in trash
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit hunter in GA

customer_reviews.title: Short life span
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 3 months then it just stopped reading the temp. File 86.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey Bechard

customer_reviews.title: Temp doesn't start at current temp
customer_reviews.text: Came saying it was 125 degrees, you can twist the stem to get to the right temp, but then you need 2 thermometers one to find the temp then this one to put in oil... Seems pretty stupid, it turns so easily too that I wouldn't trust it to stay where I placed it so I would need to check the starting temp every time, junk
customer_reviews.author: scott g grempler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Thermometer with correct readings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my 5 Qt. Lodge cast iron dutch oven. The clip works great. It is very tall but I like that the dial is farther from the heat and easy to read. I compared the readings with my digital thermometer and it was right on.
customer_reviews.author: omjewelie

customer_reviews.title: Had to calibrate
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be pretty well made but I did have to calibrate it. It was off by about 12 degrees. It is easy enough to calibrate with the nut in the back but I feel like it should be more accurate out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Off by over 60  degrees and cannot return it as it's been appx. 45 days since purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Thermometer reads appx. 50-60 degrees higher than temp really is. Bought it on June 12th and here I am six weeks later and it says not eligible to return. I would not buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: TH Houston

customer_reviews.title: poorly designed clip
customer_reviews.text: The clip would not hold the thermometer in place in a 5 quart cast iron dutch oven while frying chicken. The metal in the clip is junk which makes the thermometer useless. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: the mount is a bit flimsy but it does the job and was not too badly priced. Although I would like to know the whole sale price because like most imported items probably costs very little to make
customer_reviews.author: StarWitch

customer_reviews.title: Pretty accurate according to my other thermometers, nice long sensor
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. If I could change anything, I'd make the clip a little more sturdy and make the readout more visible. I use it for outdoor frying. It would nice to not have to get so close to the burner and oil to read it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Park

customer_reviews.title: Using it for my straw bale veggie garden
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermometer for my straw bale veggie garden. It is indespencable.
customer_reviews.author: Sallie Ann Gillen

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly calibrated out of the box.  Clip is still annoying though
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly calibrated straight out of the box. However, as some have complained, the clip doesnt function well. It’s an easy fix if you bend it and you can see another reviewer who posted pics on how to do it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with the reading during my first attempt at frying but the clip was not sturdy. I used with dutch over and it kept falling over. Unfortunately I only got one use out of it. When I went to clean the rod I found that the meter top spun around and I was unable to tighten it, leading me to wonder if it truly was accurate. Regardless the fish n' chips I made using it turned out great, just a little disappointed that I could only reliably use it once.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is junk! First time using it, it didn’t work. The return window closed yesterday so I can’t even return it. Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be pretty accurate for checking water temperature. Easy to clean and read. Feels like a quality made product. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MDP

customer_reviews.title: Works as needed
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if you are supposed to but I keep it in the pot the whole time while frying. The attachment point is so thin that it tips and falls out when bumped lightly.
customer_reviews.author: Denisee

customer_reviews.title: Broken after sitting in drawer for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This product was great for me when I received it. It was easy to attach to various pots. I haven't used it in about 6 months, and after taking it out of a drawer, the baseline temperature was at 300F, and no amount of tapping, shaking, or other measure could get it back to normal, which renders it useless for me. I don't know if this is a general product defect or a one-off problem, but I haven't had similar issues with other thermometers I've owned over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it might have worked but it couldn't even make it to the house wrapped in bubble wrap. It was broken so I would assume it's very fragile. I just got my money back instead of a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Bosserdet

customer_reviews.title: Avoid, dear god AVOID
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this thing is absolute trash. After using this you’ll be willing to spend 5x as much to never have to deal with it again
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I kept waiting for the oil to get to 375, but it seemed to get stuck on 300. After a while I used a hand thermometer and it was almost 400. Seems to work better if I don't clip it and use it by hand. Must be something better out there.
customer_reviews.author: Errol Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great thermometer. Fits into our large vat and attaches to the side for easy reading.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hoffner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my kitchen accessories. Easy to read and I think pretty accurate.
customer_reviews.author: ckng60060

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile even though made for deep frying turkey! Used today for onion rings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful Utensil
customer_reviews.text: A very useful little utensil for gauging the inside temperature of pork loin, leg of lamb, etc. Easy to insert, easy to read, easy to clean. It gives you a good sense of how well cooked or not a piece of meat is on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Needle gets stuck
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually write many reviews. This thermometer is so inaccurate that I lost an entire batch of food in an outdoor fryer. The needle got stuck and the temperature went from 250 degrees to 550 in a flash. The oil was completely burnt. We had to change our dinner plans and start over.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Burke

customer_reviews.title: Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend as a surprise because he was always saying he wanted one and of course we got it and he had to use it as soon as it was delivered! and he approved and loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Rae Hott

customer_reviews.title: Love this product, but I wish it was shorter.
customer_reviews.text: I love this, but I wish it was shorter. I use it for my all-natural homemade wax.
customer_reviews.author: Tami tam

customer_reviews.title: Fine if accuracy isn’t important
customer_reviews.text: I need a mangy glass to read the dial and the wand is way too long.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME , i love this. Perfectly cooked food every time.
customer_reviews.author: Grams M

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking on the campfire!
customer_reviews.text: I caught some fish and fried them over a campfire Saturday. I had a tripod with my pot of oil on it. I raised and lowered the pot to get the oil to 360 degrees. Fish turned out perfect! It would not have been possible without this thermometer. I got the longer one. Couldn't be more satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: K. Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: THERMOMETER AND CLIP WORK GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what was discribed....package was open on delivery but it contents where still there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet but I'm impressed with the look and quality.
customer_reviews.author: texasjere

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: My thermometer stopped working after 4 uses!! What a rip off. Half way through candy making only to realize the reading was completely inaccurate. I wanted to double check and tested in boiling water and it only went to 190. So mad.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Inthavong

customer_reviews.title: KT THERMO Deep Fry Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I used this item for the oil temperature when i deep fry turkeys.. Seems accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McNally

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Simple. Goes to a. High temp and very versatile. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: E. Rios

customer_reviews.title: Longer, but works great
customer_reviews.text: this thermometer is a lot longer than I expected but it still worked perfectly to use in a deep Dutch oven for fry chicken!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Querbach

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Good Product. Does what it claims. Should have brought one a little more expensive for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Great for my wok !
customer_reviews.text: Use this for deep-frying .... keeping my cooking oil at 350 degrees !
customer_reviews.author: J Kimura

customer_reviews.title: It’s one hot item!  (After immediate use)
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my turkey deep frying. Only advice is please do not purchase for use as a rectal thermometer. That should be obvious, but....
customer_reviews.author: Maui Madness

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but I returned it for a digital thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid Fryer Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Worked well and reached deep into fryer. The indicator flag on the rim is helpful. It can be set ahead of time so that you can just glance at the dial to see if the temp is right rather than having to read the figures. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Barron

customer_reviews.title: Good for deep frying
customer_reviews.text: It works great and has a reasonable cost. Easy to use on a deep fryer.
customer_reviews.author: John Qiu

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed by the length of the stem, but it's useable.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different one
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, not worth the money. There are too many other ones on the market. The little red indicator doesn’t stay in place so it’s kind of worthless
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love my new KT THERMO A necessary purchase and glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: The Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Works.. Sort of...
customer_reviews.text: The gauge its self works like a champ. The clip supplied not so much. Last about a month before it would really clip to the side of the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Run And Do Not Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was the WORST investment to make candles with. The temperature readings are all over the place, 8 fingers and 2 thumbs down!
customer_reviews.author: JRan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looked nice, but gave as a gift, so unsure of it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great, cleans great, reasonable cost. what more can you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: mizztanya

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice and now it’s broken. At room temp, it reads 500 degrees. Return window ended 2 weeks ago smh.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Used it a dozen times now. I use it to make tea and it always have served me well. Can’t complain
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Pan

customer_reviews.title: Garbage quality or QC.
customer_reviews.text: Product broke after about 4 uses. Always hand washed after every use and kept cap on end in storage. I must be in hell because it’s saying everything is 450° and I paid 16 dollars for a junk item.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product but make sure you have a really deep fryer to use it in.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: After first use, it has been stuck at 150-degree mark and now rises from there... wont go back 0
customer_reviews.author: just my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer arrived and upon opening it indicated my house temperature was 200 degrees F. Since I was still alive and felt comfortable I decided it was not very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make your cooking,easier
customer_reviews.text: Iike how accurate it is. How good it is to know the exact temp.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Very Practical
customer_reviews.text: The long stem keeps your hand from cooking while trying to find the temperature. Works well and fast
customer_reviews.author: BLKSUPERIOR

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to accurate
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is not even close to accurate. I just threw my money away
customer_reviews.author: Coral

customer_reviews.title: Junk, skip this one. 100 degrees off.
customer_reviews.text: Over 100 degrees off my thermopen, flimsy holder needed to be propped up since it was top heavy. It’s junk.
customer_reviews.author: Alex White

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk that broke after only 4 uses. I was very disappointed with how flimsy the clamp was too.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Binder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great accuracy for temperature in deep frying at a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Twyla Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor Quality, Broke after 2 days.... Save your money and time...
customer_reviews.author: Baydre

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, it is difficult to see the tiny ...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, it is difficult to see the tiny degree marks on the dial but it meets my needs and was well prices.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Writing is a bit small
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Writing is a bit small; difficult to read.
customer_reviews.author: Collina

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this item
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this item. I’ve only used it twice the first time it registered the right temperature after that the dial was stuck on 150° prior to putting it in oil and would not operate properly I plan on contacting Amazon to see if I can get a refund. I won’t buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy J O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: Temperature at rest is fifty degrees.
customer_reviews.text: needle not at zero, but at 50 degrees. Not sure how to adjust the needle. usually there is a screw or something to make the adjustment. I coujldn't find it. so when using it, necessary to ad fifty degrees to the reading. otherwise, it works.
customer_reviews.author: ronald peters

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good. Doesn't Do All it Says
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking. I would imagine for many applications it would work well. The clip that holds the thermometer to the pan for deep frying is very light duty and will not stabilize the unit. I am deep frying in a 12" cast iron Dutch Oven and it will not grip the sides. Had to go back to the cheap glass candy thermometer. I'll try it when we bake a turkey or something else.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Hoppe

customer_reviews.title: No Accurate
customer_reviews.text: My first clue was when my sugar read at 220F, but was past 320 and beginning to caramelize. Tests conducted with a classic mercury thermometer show that it sticks around 210-230, and is useless for sugar work. I guess the one star can be for the clip that comes with it, because it worked like a charm and I'll be putting it on another thermostat
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: Totally inaccurate!!! Over 100 degree off (low) from actual temperature. Almost had a grease fire because the oil started to smoke while the thermometer only showed 285 degrees. Measured the oil after taking it off the burner with a digital thermometer and it read 415 degrees. I bought this to use in a deep cast iron pot for deep frying but is useless for that application!
customer_reviews.author: Raibeart

customer_reviews.title: Total rubbish
customer_reviews.text: This is garbage.. There is no calibrating this instrument. I fried with it the day I got it and I am a Chef. It does not work. So annoyed. Rubbish.
customer_reviews.author: Neil M

customer_reviews.title: Great piece to have at home.
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy this thermostat because the grip can be moved up and down. This helps when I use it for a pan or pot. Also, I used it when I was baking a chicken. It's length didn't require me to stick my hand into the oven. I was able to check the temperature from a distance. Loved it.
customer_reviews.author: RONALD L. MITCHELL

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I put the last half inch of the thermometer in water and brought it to a boil. As the water started to boil the thermometer read 150F. I imagine if you put the entire thermometer into a turkey it may read accurately or then again it may not. Im not going to wreck an entire bird to prove this works. I’m calling it a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chugg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer arrived set on 350 degrees f. I reset it by twisting the nut on the bottom. I then plunged it into boiling water and it registered 100 degrees f. Which means I should have been able to plunge my hands into the water. Try as I might I couldn’t fix it and wound up throwing it away. I carelessly threw the box away or I would have returned it. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone in spite of the positive reviews. You might get a good one but why take a chance. I hate wasting money and now I am still looking for a good thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C. Moreland

customer_reviews.title: Keep me from burning my house down. Fool proof.
customer_reviews.text: I was using a digital thermometer to monitor fry oil temperature and I noticed the temperature was lower than expected and the oil was turning black and bubbling. Electronic failure, probably minutes away from catastrophic fire. This probe is based on physics. Bi-metallic thermometers work on the principle of different metals expand with differently. There is nothing to fail. I'll keep my digital for bread and meat. :O
customer_reviews.author: bulldawg1964

customer_reviews.title: great therm
customer_reviews.text: i tested it with ice water and boiling water for accuracy and it work like a charm now i can tell exact temp of my milk for yogurt and oil for deep frying
customer_reviews.author: dreadylock

customer_reviews.title: Good, but clamp not up to the task
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer works great. I like the adjustable depth and the ability to rotate the shaft to allow easy view of the temp. What is quite frustrating is the flimsy clamp. It's thin metal is too weak to grasp the pan, and too narrow to allow the thermometer to remain upright. I slid a kabob spear under the flat top of the clamp to keep it from leaning. Usable, but the manufacturer should go back to the drawing board. Or better, the test kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Great for Grilling and in the oven
customer_reviews.text: It's true, the needle swings around quickly, but does take a few extra seconds to get to the desired 165 F after it zooms to 150 F. I like it better than the electronic one I had. Have yet to try it making caramels where the temperature precision is more important.
customer_reviews.author: Old Salt

product_meta.title: KT THERMO Deep Fry Thermometer With Instant Read,Dial Thermometer,12" Stainless Steel Stem Meat Cooking Thermometer,Best for Turkey,BBQ,Grill
product_meta.description:
Size:12-InchKT THERMO: The best choice for your daily life
The Dial Thermometer for the oil pan, frying, barbecue temperature control. Large dial, you can reads internal food temperature instantly. Clear and accurate scale, you can get the food temperature. The durable, stainless-steel casing provides strength and corrosion resistance. Increase the service life.
Specification:
Model: B-4B0
Dial size: 2 inch
Probe: 12 inch
Material: stainless steel probe
Temperature measurement range: 50~550℉
Package included: Dial thermometers x 1, User manual x 1, Temperature clamp x 1
Warranty Period: 1 year
Would you like to change your way of life, starting from KT THERMO Dial Thermometer?
If you want to make more delicious food, please LOOK HERE. You don’t have to worry about the temperature of the food because since now you have the dial thermometer to help you. Try another kind of lifestyle by CLICKING the ADD TO CART button NOW, and KT THERMO provides you with the best option.
About KT THERMO: 
KT THERMO is a professional thermometer manufacturer, providing optimal products aimed at satisfying our daily-life. We have the most advanced bimetal movement process control equipment, circuit board SMT chip production equipment and dozens of the world's leading temperature test equipment. We have professional R & D team, the new products had more than 20 utility model patents, and some products for the United States by the NSF certification, the European CE and other relevant certification.
feature_bullets: MULTI-PURPOSE: Mechanical induction, can be directly and accurately measure the oil pan, frying, barbecue temperature control.
MEASURING A WIDE RANGE: This Dial thermometer has a range of 50 degrees Fahrenheit to 550 degrees Fahrenheit, measurable boiling or frozen things.
COMPACT STAINLESS STEEL CONSTRUCTION: The durable, stainless-steel casing provides strength and corrosion resistance. Easy to use and easy to clean.
EQUIPPED WITH TEMPERATURE CLAMP: Can be used to hold the thermometer when the temperature is measured, which prevents the thermometer from falling into the container at the measured temperature
RELIABLE AND FRIENDLY CUSTOMER SERVICE: Always be ready to respond within a 24-hour time frame.
